The new monitors will allow for viewing of telemetry patients on both fifth and sixth floor Medical Surgical Units in a single location.The telemetry observer would be responsible for monitoring up to and will not exceed 32 patients.The Telemetry observers may not leave their assignment without appropriate relief; only colleagues who have completed the TLC education and have completed the performance check list are permitted to function as a telemetry observer. Nursing Supervisors are not permitted to relieve telemetry observers for meal breaks; meal coverage must be done by a colleague with the appropriate training.  Supervisors must be immediately available for any emergent situation that arises.Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities.  Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on February 7, 2024, at Lehigh Valley Hospital - Schuylkill which included the use of trained telemetry observers in the new telemetry viewing monitor room located in room 623 on the sixth floor.
